Irene_Kelley:
{{short description|American country and bluegrass musician}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Irene Kelley | image = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Latrobe, Pennsylvania]]{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|page=89|year=2008|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} | genre = [[Country music|Country]], [[Bluegrass music|bluegrass]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = | years_active = 1980s–present | label = [[MCA Records|MCA]], Madacy, Irk, Patio, [[Mountain Fever Records|Mountain Fever]] | associated_acts = | website = {{URL|www.irenekelley.com/}} }} '''Irene Kelley''' is an American [[Country music|country]] and [[Bluegrass music|bluegrass]] musician. As a songwriter, she has written for [[Ricky Skaggs]], [[Alan Jackson]], [[Loretta Lynn]], and [[the Osborne Brothers]].{{cite news|last1=Lawless|first1=John|title=Carolina Wind- new single from Irene Kelley|url=http://bluegrasstoday.com/carolina-wind-new-single-from-irene-kelley/|accessdate=2 July 2016|publisher=Bluegrass Today|date=16 March 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Recker|first1=Scott|title=Pennsylvania Coal|url=http://www.popmatters.com/review/178322-irene-kelley-pennsylvania-coal/|accessdate=5 July 2016|publisher=PopMatters|date=12 February 2014}} ==Early life== Kelley is originally from Pennsylvania and in high school sang in a Led Zeppelin cover band.{{cite news|last1=Clementi|first1=Tyler|title=How Led Zeppelin led to Bluegrass for Irene Kelley|url=http://www.columbusunderground.com/how-led-zeppelin-led-to-bluegrass-for-irene-kelley-dd1|accessdate=4 July 2016|publisher=Columbus Underground|date=8 February 2015}} She was asked to leave the group after suggesting the band cover songs from Dolly Parton. ==Career== Kelley moved to Nashville, Tennessee in the early 1980s. This was after visiting on her honeymoon in 1983 and discovering the first gathering of the [[International Bluegrass Music Association]].{{cite news|last1=Fox|first1=Randy|title=Irene Kelley's roots run deep through Pennsylvania Coal|url=http://www.nashvillescene.com/nashville/irene-kelleys-roots-run-deep-through-pennsylvania-coal/Content?oid=4059487|accessdate=2 July 2016|publisher=Nashville Scene|date=13 February 2014|ref=NashScene}} Kelley co-wrote the [[Ricky Skaggs]] and [[The Whites|Sharon White]] song "[[Love Can't Ever Get Better Than This]]" with Nancy Montgomery. The song peaked at number ten on the ''Billboard'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles]] chart in 1987 and was awarded Duet of the Year at the [[Country Music Association Awards]] that same year.{{cite news|last1=Cooper|first1=Peter|title=Ricky Skaggs and Sharon White find harmony|url=http://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/peter-cooper/2014/10/03/ricky-skaggs-sharon-white-find-harmony/16586533/|accessdate=2 July 2016|publisher=The Tennessean|date=3 October 2014}} Kelley signed to [[MCA Records]] in the late 1980s. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details !
